Rule 10b-5.definition: a rule adopted by the Securities and Exchange Commission in furtherance of the Securities Exchange Act that outlaws fraud
Rule 10b-5.origin: [ 10b-5 from the section of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 pursuant to which the rule was formulated]

1.1: a rule adopted by the Securities and Exchange Commission in furtherance of the Securities Exchange Act that outlaws fraud, deceit, misrepresentation, and manipulation in securities dealing in broad terms
